content.title: General Pre Matric Scholarship-Uttar Pradesh
content.beneficiary: Students from General castes enrolled in Class 9 or 10
content.details: The Social Welfare Department recognizes the importance of education in shaping the future, and is committed to providing opportunities for all. That's why they offer scholarships to financially disadvantaged students from General castes, enrolled in Class 9 or 10. This program bridges the financial gap that can hinder a student's academic journey, empowering them to complete secondary school and pursue their educational goals. By alleviating the financial burden on families, the scholarship encourages students to stay in school, focus on their studies, and reach for a brighter future through higher education.
eligibility: Beneficiary must be a resident of Uttar Pradesh.
Beneficiary must belong to the General category.
Beneficiaries who are dependents of people in occupations traditionally considered untouchable.
Beneficiaries' parents' annual income should not be more than ₹2,50,000/-.
All the children of the applicant's parents will be eligible.
Students cannot receive other scholarships alongside this one (with some exceptions).
Beneficiary's age limit is 12 to 20 years old (as of July 1st).
documents_required: Mark sheet of your last qualifying examination.
Bank passbook photocopy (where the scholarship amount will be deposited).

faqs.question: What is this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Uttar Pradesh Social Welfare Department offers a Pre Matric Scholarship for General Category students. This scholarship aims to financially assist students from these categories to pursue secondary education and complete their matriculation.

faqs.question: How much financial benefits are provided?
Who can get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: All eligible students from the resident of Uttar Pradesh can get the scheme benefits.

faqs.question: What is the caste eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant must belong to the General category.

faqs.question: What is educational eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant must be studying in Class 9 or 10 in a recognized school.

faqs.question: What is financial eligibility criteria?
faqs.answer: Applicant family's annual income must not exceed ₹2,50,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: The applicant will have to register himself online, fill out the application form, download the filled application form and submit it to the institute.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: Mark sheet of your last qualifying examination, Income certificate of your family, Bank passbook photocopy, Fee receipt number (if applicable), Enrollment number, Aadhar card number, Latest passport-sized photograph.
